intro: Aleuritia chumbiensis, commonly known as the Chumbi alder, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the family Betulaceae, which includes birches and alders, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish catkins that are typical of the family, and it flowers in the spring. It is often found in moist, temperate forests at high altitudes, contributing to the biodiversity of its ecosystem. Its hardy nature makes it an important component of the understory vegetation in these regions.
